text: Quite funny. The man's mortgage is in peril.
Yep, the guy had nothing to offer you. What a waste of space.
I have canned email responses for these kind of recruiters.btw: details of an opportunity, has nothing to do with the ACTUAL details!
I thought his response where he mentioned Location, Money and type of Company interesting.  It seems the type of work and technologies used there is not something he cares about.

I've had a couple of emails from a recruiter this morning along the same lines. Wondering if it's the same guy.There needs to be a RateMyRecruiter.com to help find decent, if they exist, recruiters. Though they'll probably flood it with fake ratings. Would need a technical test before being allowed to make a rating :)

Have you had the "I want you to work exclusively with me, so take your CV off linked in, monster etc..." or I won't send you any of my amazing, exclusive oppourtunities?That one always makes me chuckle.As did "My client are looking for a SQL 2005/2008 DBA, that works on Linux"I guess the above was selling me a car or kitchen a couple of weeks prior to that email...

Yeah - why do so many of them send job titles which are clearly irrelevant when they have only contacted because they saw my CV on their agency db - I know why ;)Sometimes I reply back saying that the one they sent wasn't quite relevant but give them details of my expectations which are high - especially the renumeration!!Never know, I might strike lucky!!
